utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Hey. Slow down, sister.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Actually, I need to speed up. Rachel woke up early with a fever and she's been terrorizing me all morning. I'm already late.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Sorry, stakeout went longer than I thought. Have you ever been to a rave?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: You're already late and Rachel's sick. Neither of which can be solved by you leaving right this second.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The entire hospital is depending on a proposal I've yet to finish, and need to present at 8:30.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: I'll have you on the road in ten minutes. Come on, you don't want to go into your meeting all tight and stressed out, do you?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: That's yours. It's House.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Ignore it.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: It says "emergency page."

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I said ignore it.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Sweet.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: I'm sorry. It's hard to pace yourself when you've been thinking about it for ten hours straight.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That's great. Now I'm late, stressed out, and frustrated.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Sorry. If you give me a minute, I can –

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It'll wait. You can do it.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Do what?

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: I thought you were coming in at 7:30.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Rachel woke up with a fever and then I...Just couldn't get here any sooner.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: There's a problem in the pharmacy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, boss lady! You don't answer emergency pages anymore?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Tell them all I'll be by as soon as I can and tell him I assumed it was either about the wolf again or the procedure I refused to approve yesterday.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Turned out it wasn't a resistant staph, but I still say that if it had been, infecting him with malaria –

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Seriously, House, I don't have time for this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're lying.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I have a meeting in 20 minutes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not talking about your meeting. I'm talking about the phone call.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I didn't ask what you were talking about, because I don't care.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was with your boytoy on a stakeout last night.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You were with Lucas?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He needed someone who could diagnose a soft tissue injury from across the street. Apparently he doesn't know any good doctors.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Or the ones he does know actually have lives outside of work.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Things got a little slow, so we made some wagers. One being whether I could get you to stop the miscegenation with an emergency page.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What made you think we'd –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He said you guys do it every morning.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Everybody lies. Remember?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So you weren't actually –

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Good-bye, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm gonna need a definitive answer before any money changes hands.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: Sorry to interrupt, but the GRC called about the budgets, the pharmacy is still waiting, and your 8:30 just arrived on campus. He should be here in ten minutes.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Figured this would be the one day he comes early. Can you proofread this for me?

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: When are you gonna find your own assistant?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Not today. Thank you. I'll be back in five.

utterance.speaker: Claudia
utterance.content: Dr. Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I know we're usually fine with two CS reps, but I want a few extra hands today just in case. And have IT recheck the network. I don't want to hear later that the new lines can only dial out or the computer crashed.

utterance.speaker: Claudia
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hopefully nothing. Just make sure you're ready if people start calling.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You wanted to see me?

utterance.speaker: Oscar
utterance.content: Hey, Dr. Cuddy. Yeah, uh, I wanted to let you know there's a problem with one of the orders that came in last night.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Which is?

utterance.speaker: Oscar
utterance.content: They sent double the amount of meds we ordered.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Did you call and ask why?

utterance.speaker: Oscar
utterance.content: Yeah. They insist it's not a mistake.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So fax them the original PO.

utterance.speaker: Oscar
utterance.content: Yeah, that's what I was planning on doing, but, um... I can't find it. Actually, I can't find any of them.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oscar, I don't have time to straighten out your paperwork. Where's Stan?

utterance.speaker: Oscar
utterance.content: He doesn't get in till 9:00 and it's actually not my paperwork. It's Gail's paperwork, and she's out sick today.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So put it on her desk and let her figure it out when she comes back.

utterance.speaker: Oscar
utterance.content: All right, but it's not my problem if –

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oscar, not today, okay? Was it the whole shipment or just one med?

utterance.speaker: Oscar
utterance.content: It's just one.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Vicodin?

utterance.speaker: Oscar
utterance.content: No, 25 milligram ephedrine tablets.

utterance.speaker: Oscar
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Call Gail. Tell her I want to see her in my office ASAP.

utterance.speaker: Oscar
utterance.content: But she's sick.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: This place is full of sick people. Just get her in here.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: Dr. Cuddy, your 8:30 is waiting in your office.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Now.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oh, I got to make a quick trip upstairs. Can you get the guy in my office a cup of coffee? I'll be right back. I've gotten you coffee before.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Hourani
utterance.content: It's freezing in here. I can hardly feel my fingers.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Please tell me you didn't send a 911 page to tell me the heater's broken.

utterance.speaker: Hourani
utterance.content: It's not broken. House bribed the physical plant to turn on the AC so I'd hurry up.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So hurry up.

utterance.speaker: Hourani
utterance.content: This man's abdomen is wide open. His core temp is down to 95.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Fine. I will deal with it.

utterance.speaker: Hourani
utterance.content: You better or I'm gonna file –

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't care what he told you. Turn it back up now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thought you had an important meeting.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're an idiot. What are you gonna do the next time one of your patients needs a liver transplant?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go talk to Wilson about something completely unrelated and see what happens. Mystery infection guy is now covered in boils and has an abscess big enough to put your fist in. He needs to get into an OR tout suite.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hourani will be done soon.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good. I'll have some hot chocolate waiting.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Marina, hey. How's she doing? She vomited? Give her some more ibuprofen and put her in the bath for a bit. And call me in a half an hour if it doesn't go down. Sorry, Marina. I have another call. Just call me in a half an hour either way.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hey. What's up? Tell him I'm halfway there. He's the one who insisted on the early meeting. I – all right, I'm coming.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Morning Eli. Sorry about the wait.

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: Oh, it's all right. I hear you got a sick kid. Yeah, I know what that's like. Or, I should say my wife does.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So you guys ready to give some ground so we can make this deal?

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: Why would we do that?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We've been going at this for eight months.

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: Soon as you decide to get reasonable.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm the one that's unreasonable? You've taken weeks to respond to every proposal I've presented.

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: Atlanticnet Insurance is the largest healthcare provider in New Jersey, and you're not the only hospital whose contracts are up. So is your team ready to come back to the table?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yeah. We're not going to. This is our final offer. We're willing to go with a capitated structure, but we need at least 12% increase in reimbursements across the board.

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: Well, the good news is I can give you a quick response. Not a chance. But as always, nice talking to you. Say hi to your sister for me.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: If you don't accept the offer, we're gonna terminate the contract.

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: Gonna be hard to keep this place open if all your patients have to pay cash. Princeton Plainsboro is the smallest hospital in our entire network.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We're also the best.

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: Doesn't matter. We are responsible for covering 13 million people. We don't have enough cash to buy them all Maseratis.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I know what you paid Bergen, Newark Beth Israel, Robert Wood Johnson –

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: 'Cause they have leverage. You can be expensive or small, but you can't be both.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I've engaged Jones/Curtin to handle the PR, and I'm prepared to make the announcement at 3:00 p.m. today.

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: First lesson every good poker player learns is don't get emotional. You don't have the cards. And the sooner you realize that, the sooner a reasonable contract will get signed.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You have until 3:00 p.m. to change your mind.

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: I always did like your style. Gonna be sad to see you go.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: They're waiting for you in the conference room.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Thanks. Uh, take this up to the call center and tell Claudia to give one to each CS rep and to start going over the answers to each question.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And under no circumstances is any of this info to go outside that room. The scripts are numbered and I want a list of every person she gives one to.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: Got it. Anything else?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you really wanted to make a deal, you should have ditched the push-up and gone with a demi. Nothing makes a guy wanna close like high beams.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What have you heard?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your meeting with the weasel lasted less than five minutes, which means you either agreed to a completely sensible 30-day extension or one of you issued a completely ridiculous ultimatum.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, goody. You or him?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Way to go, boss.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You said it was ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ridiculous to make, fun to watch. As long as it's not just a bluff. Please tell me it's not a bluff.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It is not a bluff, and it is not ridiculous. Just because we're not some huge –

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Mr. Pluta started hallucinating before we could put him under.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: His BP is plummeting. He has an elevated heart rate. Looks like congestive heart failure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't care how interesting it is. You are not infecting him with malaria.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Since when is malaria a cure for heart failure?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not. It's not congestive heart failure. It's gotta be...

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm sorry, Dave. I don't really have time right now –

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I took care of it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So you didn't want Chase, but now you're pissed you can't have him?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No, Dave.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No, just refereeing a dispute about the OR. So, we don't yet have a contract with Atlanticnet.

utterance.speaker: Sanford
utterance.content: We gave you an extra week and you assured us you'd have a deal by today.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We could have a deal, just not the deal we deserve.

utterance.speaker: Female Board Member
utterance.content: So what do you want, approval for an extension?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We've been at this for eight months. An extension isn't gonna change anything.

utterance.speaker: Sanford
utterance.content: So what’s your plan?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I presented a final offer. I told them that we would agree to a capitated structure if they increase reimbursements by 12%.

utterance.speaker: Female Board Member
utterance.content: A final offer? What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: If they don't accept it by 3:00, we're gonna terminate.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We're not asking for anything they can't afford.

utterance.speaker: Sanford
utterance.content: Their last offer was a 4% increase and you're demanding 12?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: They're paying even more at some places. Units that have lower ratings than ours.

utterance.speaker: Sanford
utterance.content: In a perfect world, that would definitely matter.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Sanford, they're all about growth, and they know they don't get new customers by marketing themselves as the biggest. They do it by claiming they're the best, and they can't do that if their patients can't come to us.

utterance.speaker: Sanford
utterance.content: What was Morgan's reaction when you told him?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He didn't give in, but he will. I told him I'd make the announcement at 3:00. He'll call back before then. They need us.

utterance.speaker: Sanford
utterance.content: We need each other. The negotiation is your responsibility, so we can't stop you if this is what you want to do. But just so we're clear, if we don't have a contract with Atlanticnet, you're not gonna have a contract with us.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: Guess who didn't show up for clinic duty?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oh, don't tell me. The guy with all the boils needs a liver transplant.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: No, his doctor needs a nap. You want me to try to find him?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You really need him?

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: I need someone.

utterance.speaker: Clinic Patient
utterance.content: I have cancer.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Why do you think you have cancer?

utterance.speaker: Clinic Patient
utterance.content: I don't think I have cancer. I know I have cancer. I had surgery to remove a malignant polyp in my colon six months ago, and now it's spread to my liver and lymph nodes.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So you're under the care of an oncologist?

utterance.speaker: Clinic Patient
utterance.content: Yeah, but he won't give me the prescription I need.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Do you need more painkillers?

utterance.speaker: Clinic Patient
utterance.content: No. I need breast milk.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Human breast milk?

utterance.speaker: Clinic Patient
utterance.content: Yes. It has cancer-fighting qualities.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, in newborns, it's been shown to reduce future risk.

utterance.speaker: Clinic Patient
utterance.content: No, in adults with cancer too. I - I've read studies.

utterance.speaker: Clinic Patient
utterance.content: Look... I even know a place where I can buy it. I just need a prescription so I can get reimbursed by my insurance company.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: They said they'd reimburse the cost of breast milk as a cancer treatment?

utterance.speaker: Clinic Patient
utterance.content: They reimburse prescriptions, so if you write me a prescription, then they have no choice but to pay.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, actually, they have a choice.

utterance.speaker: Clinic Patient
utterance.content: What are you, some type of shill for the insurance company?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Clinic Patient
utterance.content: Look, I've been paying premiums for 30 years, and I've never been sick a day in my life till this happened. Now I can't work, I got no money. And you want to help them screw me over?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm not screwing you over.

utterance.speaker: Clinic Patient
utterance.content: Well, then give me the script.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It won't help you.

utterance.speaker: Clinic Patient
utterance.content: Will it hurt me?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No, but –

utterance.speaker: Clinic Patient
utterance.content: Okay, so it won't harm me, and it won't harm you, but it's this insurance company –

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: This is not about insurance.

utterance.speaker: Clinic Patient
utterance.content: Then give me the damn script. I'm sick. I need help. I need something.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Clinic Patient
utterance.content: Bitch.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Anyone call?

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: Yeah. The ER. They said the vascular who's on call doesn't have privileges.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Then why is he on call?

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: Dowd's at a conference and got him to fill in.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Be nice if he got somebody who can actually work here. Call Ereshefsky.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: Ereshefsky? She's not gonna do it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She owes me a favor.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: She's still not gonna do it. All right. Oh, and there's a guy in your office. I think he's a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Why is he in my office?

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: Said he didn't want to sit around a bunch of sick people. I tried to stop him.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hi. I'm Dr. Lisa Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Westbrook
utterance.content: Ronald Westbrook. I appreciate your taking the time to meet with me.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hard to avoid since you're already in my office.

utterance.speaker: Westbrook
utterance.content: Sorry about that, I just got over a wicked cold that didn't want to –

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: How can I help you?

utterance.speaker: Westbrook
utterance.content: I represent Martín Acevedo. He's filed a suit against PPH, and Dr. Robert Chase for performing surgery without consent.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yes, I saw that. I also saw the consent forms. They were all signed.

utterance.speaker: Westbrook
utterance.content: Yes, but my client was assured that the procedure would just be a few minor sutures.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Wait. Your client accidentally cut his thumb off with a table saw, right?

utterance.speaker: Westbrook
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And Dr. Chase reattached it?

utterance.speaker: Westbrook
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're saying he didn't want it reattached?

utterance.speaker: Westbrook
utterance.content: No, he most certainly did not.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: His insurance only covered 60% of inpatient expenses, so he would only agree to the cheapest option.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So what did you tell him?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I said I'd sew up the skin over the exposed bone. Then I put him under, got his thumb from the paramedics, and reattached it. What's he gonna do? Tell the judge that I harmed him by reattaching a vital digit?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Both he and the insurance company are suing to get out of paying the bill. It's over $80,000.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It was his thumb. I couldn't just let him toss it in the trash to save a few bucks.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: Gail the pharm tech who called in sick is here. She's waiting in your office.

utterance.speaker: Gail
utterance.content: He barely even looks at me anymore. We haven't had sex in months.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You don't need pills to lose weight. There are healthier ways, legal ways.

utterance.speaker: Gail
utterance.content: You don't understand how hard it is. Ever since our second child, no matter what I do. I just wanted to lose ten more pounds and then I was gonna stop.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm sorry. Forging pharmaceutical orders, stealing –

utterance.speaker: Gail
utterance.content: Don't fire me, Dr. Cuddy, please. I'm begging you. If Sam finds out, he'll divorce me for sure, and my kids – I will never do it again, I swear. Just give me a second chance.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I won't report the theft to the DEA... But I have to fire you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Just take a few minutes to compose yourself, then go down to HR and they'll give you your last check.

utterance.speaker: Gail
utterance.content: I've been a perfect employee for seven years.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I know, but this is too big. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How's it going?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Got three hours to save this place from bankruptcy, I just fired one of my best employees, and the woman taking care of my sick child isn't returning my calls.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Rachel's gonna be fine, I'm sure whoever he or she is deserved it, and we're not going bankrupt. Are we?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Don't worry. The board will fire me before they allow that to happen.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: They'd never fire you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I just told Atlanticnet Insurance I'd terminate unless they gave us a 12% bump.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: They might fire you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Marina, hey, it's me. I haven't heard back from you. Can you call me as soon as you can? Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You try Lucas?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He's either sleeping or avoiding me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You in a fight?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Not yet, but we're gonna be.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What do you think I should do about Atlanticnet?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're asking a guy who paid full sticker price for his last car. You ask House? He's a master manipulator who always gets what he wants.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: This situation is out of control enough already. House is the last person I want to get involved.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Get out of my chair. And the answer is no.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You ever noticed how many porn sites have "mom" in the domain name? Hot moms, hungry moms, mature moms. That ought to make you feel pretty good.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What do you want?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Looks like boils, altered mental status, and heart failure was caused by renal cell carcinoma. I need your signature to start treating it with malaria. Don't worry, I'm giving him chemo too.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What is your sudden obsession with malaria?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just trying to play my part cutting costs. Malaria is the simplest, cheapest method of delivering hypothermia.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Right. The only money you care about – You bet someone you could use malaria as a diagnostic tool?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That doesn't sound like me.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Forget it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, let me see if I've got this straight, a bet that puts one patient at minor risk is juvenile?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And irresponsible and dangerous.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But going all-in against Atlanticnet –

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Is not a bet. That is a carefully considered negotiating position.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm gonna put this in your inbox. I just hope it doesn't get lost underneath all the other stuff you're carefully considering.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Can you take a look at these per diem schedules? Let me know if you see any conflicts.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: Got it. Oh, and Ereshefsky actually did come in. You catch her leaving a sponge in a guy or something?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Wasn't a medical mistake.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: What was it?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Can't tell you now. She came in.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hey, Stan! Have you audited the ephedrine orders yet?

utterance.speaker: Stan
utterance.content: Why? You told me she confessed.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Stan.

utterance.speaker: Stan
utterance.content: All right, yeah. I'll take care of it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Today.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: You know he's cussing you out in there now.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't care as long as he does it.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: What a bitch.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Sounded like you were going to be too busy for lunch, so my specialty, spinach lasagna.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Sure you didn't come looking for more people you could brag about our sex life to?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Okay. Sorry. From now on, I got nothing but bad things to say about our sex life. Or nothing to say.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And what's going on with Marina? She hasn't called me back.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: She was gonna call. I told her I'd let you know everything was okay.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So her fever broke?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: What exactly does that mean, "when a fever breaks?”

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Lucas, I'm very busy. Does she have a fever or not?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: That was gonna be your lunch? And you didn't have breakfast either. No, she doesn't have a fever, and the rash was just, like, a little diaper rash.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What rash? She has a rash?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Little one. Lisa, don't worry. I'm telling you.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Oh, god. I must have grabbed Marina's cell by mistake. And, I turned the ringer off on the home phone so I could sleep.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What are you doing to me?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: I take it your deal's not done.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: How about I take a quick look into the guy who's in charge of the negotiations? Or better yet, the CEO. If I get some dirt, you can use it as leverage.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: There's no time. How do you even find these guys?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Tannenbaum
utterance.content: You should have seen the guy's face. I thought he was gonna have a damn coronary right there in the tee box.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Excuse me. You're Keith Tannenbaum, CEO of Atlanticnet Insurance, right?

utterance.speaker: Tannenbaum
utterance.content: That's me. How can I help you?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, actually, I think we can help each other. I am Dr. Lisa Cuddy, Dean of Medicine at Princeton Plainsboro.

utterance.speaker: Tannenbaum
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Well, how are you?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, I'm a little unhappy. You're aware that our contract with your company is up this week?

utterance.speaker: Tannenbaum
utterance.content: Yes, and we have a negotiating team that's working all that out.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Princeton Plainsboro has the highest-rated ER in the state, the most advanced ICU, and the most innovative diagnostic medicine department in the entire country.

utterance.speaker: Tannenbaum
utterance.content: Good to know. Now if you don't mind, I'd like to –

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: While Atlanticnet Insurance has a marketing budget that's more than our pediatric ICU’s and transplant units combined. Your PGA sponsorship could pay for our walk-in clinic, and the money you spend to fuel your two private jets could fund our air ambulance service for the next three years.

utterance.speaker: Tannenbaum
utterance.content: Your point being?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Your growth may be good for your bottom line, but ours allows us to save lives. And I would rather not have to announce to the press how selective your company appears to be when it comes to cutting costs.

utterance.speaker: Tannenbaum
utterance.content: Morgan was right. You are one tough gal. You can portray me as a rich bastard in the press all you want, just as long as I stay rich.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: Stan is looking for you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm busy.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: He said it's urgent.

utterance.speaker: Stan
utterance.content: I don't understand how it's even possible. I've checked it twice.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: How much?

utterance.speaker: Stan
utterance.content: Ten cases.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Ten cases?

utterance.speaker: Stan
utterance.content: Going back three years.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What the hell have you been doing Stan? You're supposed to be managing this place.

utterance.speaker: Stan
utterance.content: All the paperwork I signed was correct. She must have altered the orders afterwards.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Didn't you ever cross-check it with the bills that came in?

utterance.speaker: Stan
utterance.content: I delegated it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: To whom?

utterance.speaker: Stan
utterance.content: To Gail. Look, she seemed perfectly trustworthy. How was I supposed to know?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: By doing your job.

utterance.speaker: Stan
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Have you notified the DEA?

utterance.speaker: Stan
utterance.content: The DEA?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Jeez, Stan. Hello! You don't steal $50,000 worth of pills because you want to lose weight. She's supplying a meth lab. Just get her back in here.

utterance.speaker: Stan
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Now.

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: Oh, you ever want a job, trust me. He'll double whatever you're making here.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Take it he liked my proposal.

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: Enough to tell me to get my ass back over here today. Here. He's willing to go to 8%.

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: We were at 4. Your board's gonna think you walk on water.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I want 12.

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: You're not gonna get 12. There's just no way.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: 8% barely covers our cost inflation.

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: But capitated structure should allow you to hold down inflation.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And shifts all your risk onto us, which is why we deserve 12.

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: Lisa, come on. The guy who mows my lawn makes more than my kid's teacher. Hell, the two guys whose lunch you interrupted could get fired, and their severance would be more than most of their employees make in a lifetime. It doesn't have anything to do with what you deserve. This is it. Take it or leave it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey. Know any good transplant surgeons? Turns out his kidneys aren't the only thing failing. And I know what you're thinking, but malaria wouldn't destroy his liver that fast, especially since we never infected him.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I thought you said –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Apparently Foreman now thinks that he has the authority to overrule my orders just because the FDA wouldn't approve. Don't worry. I'll deal with him. If you could just talk to Hourani –

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What would you do?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you paged me during sex?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: About the contract, with Atlanticnet. I got them to come up to 8%, but we should get at least 12.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's all numbers. Do the math, and nothing else.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's not about my pride. It's about the principle. They're trying to screw us over because we're small.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's what they're supposed to do.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: They should be pressuring other hospitals to be more like us, not trying to make us more like them. It's stupid.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Putting your job on the line in an effort to stamp out stupidity isn't?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You would.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Probably. But then I also wanted to try to cure cancer by infecting a guy with malaria to win a $50 bet. You really want to be like me?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: As you know, for the past eight months, we've been trying to renegotiate our contract with Atlanticnet Insurance. It's been a difficult process, but I wanted to let you all know before we made the formal announcement, that as of 5:00 p.m. today, our contract with Atlanticnet will be terminated. We've doubled the number of customer service representatives in our call center. Current patients will still be allowed to remain in our care for 30 days, but starting tomorrow, we will no longer be accepting patients with Atlanticnet health insurance.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Why weren't we told about this sooner?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Come on, Marina. Pick up the phone.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm busy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We found a liver match.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: All right. Get him prepped. I'll straighten things out with Hourani.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hourani's not the problem. House is. Now he wants Chase to do the surgery.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: To prove to Hourani he doesn't need him?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: To prove to Thomas that Chase was his department's best surgeon.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And what does Chase want to do?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Chase wants to do the surgery.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And you don't want him to do it because?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I don't care who does it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So what's the problem?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: In order to get our patient into the OR, we have to get him on the surgery schedule. In order to do that, we need someone to put him there who neither House nor Thomas can overrule.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Would you rather I go back on vicodin?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She's not massaging your leg.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She will... Eventually.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Why am I the only person here who cares what happens to this hospital? Get off your ass and get your department under control. At least for the next few days.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Its gonna take longer than a few days for a company the size of Atlanticnet to start feeling the squeeze of your PR Campaign. If they ever do.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And you know this how? From all the time you've spent researching them and their other contracts? The way they handle their press relations?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know they have a nascar team. Despite what you may have learned at hebrew school or from Jimmy Cliff, sometimes the bigger they are, The harder they kick your ass.

utterance.speaker: Westbrook
utterance.content: But he's also not interested in being forced into a medical bankruptcy.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Mr. Acevedo, I am sorry you're having financial difficulties. But because of us, you still have a thumb. I assume that's something a carpenter might need.

utterance.speaker: Westbrook
utterance.content: And I assume you didn't ask for this meeting so you could lecture my client.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You have insurance. But by filing this suit, you've caused us to get paid nothing by them either.

utterance.speaker: Westbrook
utterance.content: That's not our problem.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Actually it is, since he's responsible for any expense we're not reimbursed. But if you drop the suit and make it clear that Dr. Chase was acting in your best interest when he reattached your thumb, then we'll be able to resubmit the claim.

utterance.speaker: Westbrook
utterance.content: And you'll cover his deductible, attorney's fees, and 50 grand for pain and suffering?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Actually, I was thinking more like we'd cover half his deductible, which means you'd only owe $16,000.

utterance.speaker: Westbrook
utterance.content: You want him to pay you?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yes. Do you have any idea how much it costs? How many years it takes to train someone in microsurgery? We gave you back your life. You can still work. You can button your own shirt, hold a fork.

utterance.speaker: Westbrook
utterance.content: Martín, let's go.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You think you'd be in better shape without a thumb?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, so would we. But when you came in, we didn't think about that, we just took care of you, made sure we did whatever you needed to get well.

utterance.speaker: Westbrook
utterance.content: Yeah, right, all you doctors care about is healing. That's why there are all those BMWs and Porsches in the parking lot.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Damn it.

utterance.speaker: Westbrook
utterance.content: Come on, we're out of here. We'll see you in court.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're right, you will. You still have a thumb because of us, and like everyone else in this world, we don't work for free. We earn this money. And if we have to take your house to get it, we will.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: I think they're fighting.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Out of my way. Now. Out of my way.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What the hell is going on?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I told them to use their words.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: That pharm tech is back. She's in your office.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You, there. You, over there. I don't wanna hear a word out of either one of you until I get back.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You lied.

utterance.speaker: Gail
utterance.content: So? What're you gonna do about it?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, for one... Notify the DEA.

utterance.speaker: Gail
utterance.content: Good. I'm sure they'll be very interested to hear how Dr. House forced me to help him steal the meds and the administrator who he's having sex with has been helping him cover it up.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You really think you can lie your way out of this?

utterance.speaker: Gail
utterance.content: Yeah, I do. Anything else you wanna know... Bitch?

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: The hospital board's chairman wants to speak to you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Tell him I'm busy.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: I did, but he –

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Then tell him I quit.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You owe Lucas the money. We were having sex when you called.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The breast milk guy finally found a doctor to give him what he wanted. If it works, it's way better than malaria. It’s worth a shot.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I... I thought they were the ones bluffing. No way they'd let us terminate.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They're not gonna fire you. And you're not gonna quit.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because you're an idiot. This place needs you. And that matters to you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What do you think of that pharm tech, Gail?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's a sociopath.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You knew she was stealing meds?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. But have you seen the way she opens the mail?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Why didn't you ever tell me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Figured it might come in handy one day.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Gail, I like you. I always have. And I know you must've gotten sucked up into a situation you weren't able to control.

utterance.speaker: Gail
utterance.content: Really, is that what happened with you and House?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm not gonna back down just because you threaten to smear me. Now, if you agree to tell the truth, there are things I can do to help. Think about your husband, your kids. I know you're a good person deep down inside. You can't completely hide everything about yourself in seven years.

utterance.speaker: Gail
utterance.content: You're an idiot. I started stealing from here six months after you hired me. You still don't even know the half of it, and you never will. You wouldn't have even found out about this if I hadn't gotten sick. And you aren't as tough as you think you are. There's no way you'd let this job get taken away. And if I go down... You're going down.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hey... Can you tell Stan to give this to the DEA agent when he comes by.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: A flower?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Lucas gave it to me. I thought it might come in handy one day.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Least I came out on top once today.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Regina
utterance.content: Where you going?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: To hand the board my resignation. Hopefully whoever they hire to replace me can still get the 8%.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Marina! I've been trying to get in touch with you all day. All right, I understand. Just, how is Rachel? And the rash? Great. I'll be home early – oh! Aw! Perfect.

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: You bitch. I didn't think you'd actually do it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I told you I would.

utterance.speaker: Eli
utterance.content: Call the dogs off. You got your 12. Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yeeeeesss! Whooo! Yes!

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: You gonna get that?
